com.heaton.bot
Class BotExclusion

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.heaton.bot.BotExclusion
public class BotExclusion
extends java.lang.Object

The bot exclusion class is used to read and process a robots.txt file from a web site. Using this file a bot can make sure it is obeying this public policy file.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeff Heaton

isExcluded

public boolean isExcluded(java.lang.String url)
This is the main worker method for this class. This method can be called to determine if the specified URL should be excluded.
Parameters:
url - The URL to be checked.
Returns:
Returns true if the specified URL is to be excluded. Returns false if not.

getExclude

public java.util.Vector getExclude()
Returns a list of URL's to be excluded.
Returns:
A vector of URL's to be excluded.

The full URL of the robots.txt file.
